wiki.content:
"Scars" is the second single from Papa Roach's third album, Getting Away with Murder (2004), and seventh released single in total. Scars is considered to be the band's comeback single, despite being unlike their usual work. It is their biggest hit, peaking at #15 on the U.S. Billboard Hot 100. The single was certified gold (500 000 units sold) on June 6, 2005. The song, according the DVD Live & Murderous In Chicago tells the story of Jacoby Shaddix's "Horrible night in Vegas that changed my life." During live performances before playing the song Shaddix often talks about how "the song saved [his] life."
 
 Lyrics:
 
 I tear my heart open, I sew myself shut
 My weakness is that I care too much
 And my scars remind me that the past is real
 I tear my heart open just to feel
 
 Drunk and I'm feeling down
 And I just wanna be alone
 I'm pissed cause you came around
 Why don't you just go home
 Cause you channel all your pain
 And I can't help you fix yourself
 You're making me insane
 All I can say is
 
 I tear my heart open, I sew myself shut
 My weakness is that I care too much
 And our scars remind us that the past is real
 I tear my heart open just to feel
 
 I tried to help you once
 Against my own advice
 I saw you going down
 But you never realized
 That you're drowning in the water
 So I offered you my hand
 Compassion's in my nature
 Tonight is our last stand
 
 I tear my heart open, I sew myself shut
 My weakness is that I care too much
 And our scars remind us that the past is real
 I tear my heart open just to feel
 
 I'm drunk and I'm feeling down
 And I just wanna be alone
 You shouldn't ever come around
 Why don't you just go home?
 Cause you're drowning in the water
 And I tried to grab your hand
 I left my heart open
 But you didn't understand
 But you didn't understand
 Go fix yourself
 
 
 I can't help you fix yourself
 But at least I can say I tried
 I'm sorry but I gotta move on with my own life
 I can't help you fix yourself
 But at least I can say I tried
 I'm sorry but I gotta move on with my own life
 
 I tear my heart open, I sew myself shut
 My weakness is that I care too much
 And our scars remind us that the past is real
 I tear my heart open just to feel
 
 I tear my heart open, I sew myself shut
 My weakness is that I care too much
 And our scars remind us that the past is real
 I tear my heart open just to feel

wiki.summary: "Scars" is the second single from Papa Roach's third album, Getting Away with Murder (2004), and seventh released single in total. Scars is considered to be the band's comeback single, despite being unlike their usual work. It is their biggest hit, peaking at #15 on the U.S. Billboard Hot 100. The single was certified gold (500 000 units sold) on June 6, 2005. The song, according the DVD Live & Murderous In Chicago tells the story of Jacoby Shaddix's "Horrible night in Vegas that changed my life.

track.name: Scars
comments: I TEAR MY HEART OPEN JUST TO FEEEEEEEEL
I could relate to this song so much....but also sometimes you feel like this song is what you do with people that you care about [2]...
tear my heart open, I sew myself shut!!
our scars remind us that the past is real - so true ♥

I was planting a tree and doing some other yard stuff all morning, singing this song's triumphant chorus in my head, but I forgot exactly how it went, so I just kept going "My weakness is!"  I thought it was "My weakness is I think too much," but then I thought about what Papa Roach's singer looks like, and realized that line would not make much sense.  That's the strength of the song, that even if you don't know the roadmap to life, you can still improvise and do your best and things might turn out okay.  Hence this is a very important and life-affirming song for a lot of people.  Note: This is also the worst song ever made.
I tear my heart open just to feel </3
I have a special person I think about when I hear this song.
Sometimes you feel like this song is what you do with people that you care about.
@coffee_and_TV_ Hey, there's a reason songs become "mainstream" and popular.. 'cause they're good :D
